conclusion: The problem involves analyzing a U-I graph of a power source and a small light bulb to determine the output power and total power of the power source.
The graph shows two lines: a straight line representing the power source and a curved line representing the small light bulb.
The intersection point of the two lines is at \\( U = 2 \, \text{V} \\) and \\( I = 2 \, \text{A} \\).
The straight line intersects the vertical axis at \\( U = 3 \, \text{V} \\), indicating the electromotive force (emf) of the power source.

premise: The intersection point is at \\( U = 2 \, \text{V} \\) and \\( I = 2 \, \text{A} \\).
conclusion: The output power of the power source is \\( P_{\text{out}} = U \times I = 2 \, \text{V} \times 2 \, \text{A} = 4 \, \text{W} \\).

premise: The emf of the power source is 3V and the current is 2A.
conclusion: The total power of the power source is \\( P_{\text{total}} = \text{emf} \times I = 3 \, \text{V} \times 2 \, \text{A} = 6 \, \text{W} \\).
